h1.span: Fwd: Coronavirus Update 4.3.20: Take CARE of Yourselves

div.p: Dear friend:

As stricter measures are implemented to prevent community spread of COVID-19, it can be challenging to manage our day-to-day lives. Limiting our contact with others is the best form of community care during this time.

This may feel overwhelming and cause stress, fear, and anxiety in adults and children. Therefore, we must be diligent in preserving our mental, emotional, and spiritual well-being. Motivation and self-care are essential, especially during times of social distancing, which should not be confused with social isolation.
Below is information that covers:

tr.td: Protips on Mental Health and Social Distancing

div.p: During these uncertain times, self-care may feel like a luxury. But self-care is an essential investment that re-enforces the perseverance, resilience, and determination of our community.

Other information on local resources can also be found via the button below. As always, please contact my office by phone or email should you have questions, or need help navigating local and state resources.

a.span: Click here to view the Community Resource Guide

div.h1: Pro Tips on Mental Health and Social Distancing
div.p: 10 Mental Health Tips for Coronavirus Social Distancing | Partners in Health

p.a: 10 Top Tips for Good Mental Health | People First

Social distancing tips: the rules of safe shopping under coronavirus | The Guardian
Tips for good mental health | Health Direct
Working Remotely During COVID-19 | Workplace Mental Health
19 immersive museum exhibits you can visit from your couch | PBS
100 Books to Read before You Die: Creating the Ultimate List | Medium

100 things to do while stuck inside due to a pandemic | USA Today

The 50 Best Podcasts to Listen to Right Now | Time

The best YouTube channels for 2020 | Digital Trends
6 social distancing tips for parents | Children’s Health
Avoid Cabin Fever With These 125 Ideas to Keep Kids Entertained During the Coronavirus Crisis | Parade.com
Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) advice for the public: Healthy Parenting | World Health Organization
Lower Your Expectations, And Other Parenting Advice For The Era Of COVID-19 | Colorado Public Radio

Tips for parenting during the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak | UNICEF
The Shelter-in-Place Survival Plan for Parents | NY Mag
People financially affected by COVID-19 outbreak are experiencing more psychological distress than others | Pew Research
Tips From Someone With Nearly 50 Years Of Social Distancing Experience | NPR
The $94 billion fitness industry is reinventing itself as Covid-19 spreads | CNN
Why your mental health may be suffering in the COVID-19 pandemic | PBS
Statewide COVID-19 Mental Health Support Line | Texas Health and Human Services (24 hours a day, 7 days a week toll-free at 833-986-1919)
General mental health resources | National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI)
COVID-19 (CORONAVIRUS) Information and Resources | NAMI
Managing Stress and Anxiety | Centers for Disease Control

Mental Health And COVID-19 – Information And Resources | Mental Health America
31 Tips To Boost Your Mental Health | Mental Health America
National Domestic Violence Hotline | National Domestic Violence Hotline
SAMHSA National Helpline | Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration
Tips For Social Distancing, Quarantine, And Isolation During An Infectious Disease Outbreak | Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration
Resources to Support Mental Health and Coping with the Coronavirus (COVID-19) | Suicide Prevention Resource Center
Mental health and psychosocial considerations during the COVID-19 outbreak | World Health Organization
Sincerely,

Physical Address: 821 NE 'G' Avenue
Mailing Address: P.O. Box 697, Fabens, TX 79838
